tu.tuv: tatra katamā bodhisatvasya dhyānapāramitā ‘ yatrodyuktā bodhisatvā mahāsatvā bodhisatvacaryāṃ caranti
舍利子。菩薩摩訶薩為眾生故。具足勤修四種靜慮。何謂為四。
禪定波羅蜜多品第十之一復次舍利子。云何菩薩摩訶薩。修行進趣菩薩禪定波羅蜜多之行。

| bam po bcu drug pa || de la gaṅ la byaṅ chub sems dpa’ sems dpa’ chen po brtson na byaṅ chub sems dpa’ spyad pa spyod par ’gyur ba’i byaṅ chub sems dpa’ rnams kyi bsam gtan gi pha rol tu phyin ba gaṅ źe na |
What, then, is the bodhisatva’s perfection of meditation, by which bodhisatvas, great beings strive to practice the way of the bodhisatva?
iti hi śāriputra bodhisatvo viviktaṃ kāmair viviktaṃ pāpakair akuśalair dharmmaiḥ savitarkaṃ savicāraṃ savivekajaṃ prītisukhaṃ prathamaṃ dhyānam upasaṃpadya II II viharati II
舍利子。菩薩摩訶薩離欲離惡不善法故。有尋有伺離生喜樂。是名菩薩安住第一具足靜慮。
舍利子。菩薩摩訶薩。應先遠離染欲過失諸不善法。於彼尋伺發生喜樂。是名入解初禪定行。

śā ri’i bu ’di la byaṅ chub sems dpa’ ’dod pa rnams las dben pa || sdig pa mi dge ba’i chos rnams las dben pa || rtog pa daṅ bcas pa | dpyod ba daṅ bcas pa || dben pa las skyes pa’i dga’ ba daṅ | bde ba can bsam gtan daṅ po rdzogs par byas te gnas so ||

Śāriputra, the bodhisatva has left desires behind. He has left evil, unwholesome qualities behind, and attains and abides in the first dhyāna, the state of joy and happiness that is born from aloofness, and that includes conceptualization and deliberation.
punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisa II II tvo vitarkavicāraṇāṃ vyupaśamād adhyātmasaṃprasādāc cetasa ekotībhāvād avitarkam avicāram samādhijāṃ prītisukhaṃ dvitīyaṃ dhyānam upasaṃpadya viharati II
又舍利子。菩薩摩訶薩滅尋伺故。內正等淨。心一趣體。無尋無伺。定生喜樂。是名菩薩安住第二具足靜慮。
舍利子。菩薩摩訶薩。次當遠離尋伺於內引生清淨潔白心一境性。於彼等持發生喜樂。是名入解二禪定行。

śā ri’i bu gźan yaṅ yaṅ byaṅ chub sems dpa’ rtog pa daṅ dpyod pa ñe bar źi źiṅ naṅ yoṅs su daṅ ste || sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa || dpyod pa med pa || tiṅ ṅe (2) ’dzin las skyes pa’i dga’ ba daṅ bde ba can bsam gtan gñis pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so ||

Then, Śāriputra, the bodhisatva, having stilled conceptualization and deliberation, with a mind which has calmed itself and become focused, attains and abides in the second dhyāna, the state of joy and happiness that is born from concentration, and that is without conceptualization or deliberation.

punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisatvaḥ prīter virāgād upekṣako viharati smṛtimāṃ saṃprajānaḥ sukhaṃ ca kāyena pratisaṃvedayate yat tad āryā ācakṣate upekṣakaḥ smṛtimāṃ sukhavihārī niṣprītikaṃ tṛtīyaṃ dhyānam upasaṃpadya viharati II
又舍利子。菩薩摩訶薩。為離喜故。便住於捨。正念正知。身正受樂。眾聖所說。有捨有念。樂住離喜。是名菩薩安住第三具足靜慮。
舍利子。菩薩摩訶薩。次當捨離貪愛行念正知。唯妙樂受身雖正知。如彼聖人觀察捨念離喜妙樂行故。是名入解三禪定行。

śā ri’i bu gźan yaṅ byaṅ chub sems dpa’ dga’ ba’i ’dod chags daṅ bral bas btaṅ sñoms la gnas śiṅ dran pa daṅ śes bźin can yin te || bde ba lus kyis myoṅ ba || ’phags pa rnams kyis gaṅ de dran pa daṅ ldan pa || bde ba la gnas pa || btaṅ sñoms pa’o || źes brjod pa ste || dga’ ba med pa’i bsam gtan gsum pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so ||

Then, Śāriputra, the bodhisatva abides in equanimity because he is not attached to joy, and with mindfulness and thoughtfulness experiences happiness in his body. This is how the noble ones see it. He attains and abides in the third dhyāna, with equanimity and mindfulness, abiding in happiness, without joy.

punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisatvaḥ sukhasya ca prahāṇād duḥkhasya ca prahāṇāt pūrvam eva ca saumanasyadaurmanasyayor astagamād aduḥkhāsukham upekṣāsmṛtipariśuddhaṃ caturthaṃ dhyānam upasaṃpadya viharati ‘
又舍利子。菩薩摩訶薩。為斷樂故。斷苦為先。及憂喜沒。不苦不樂。捨念清淨。是名菩薩安住第四具足靜慮。
舍利子。菩薩摩訶薩。次當如是先斷苦樂適悅煩惱。無苦無樂捨念清淨。是名入解四禪定行。

śā ri’i bu gźan yaṅ byaṅ chub sems dpa’ bde ba yaṅ spaṅs te || sṅa nas sdug bsṅal yaṅ spaṅs śiṅ yid bde ba daṅ yid mi bde ba yaṅ nub pas de ba yaṅ ma yin || sdug bsṅal ba yaṅ ma yin pa btaṅ sñom daṅ dran pa yoṅs su dag pa’i bsam gtan bźi ba rdzogs par byas te gnas so ||

Then, Śāriputra, the bodhisatva, having rid himself of happiness, and of suffering, and having already put an end to positivity and negativity of mind, attains and abides in the fourth dhyāna, free from suffering and happiness, and with completely pure equanimity and mindfulness.
sa tathā samāhitacittaḥ pariśuddhaḥ paryavadāto naṃgaṇo vigatopakleśaḥ samādhiṃ ca na riṃcati dhyānakarma ca karoti II
舍利子。菩薩摩訶薩。於是靜慮。定心清白無有穢濁。離隨煩惱不捨深定。而能發起一切靜慮種種作業。是名菩薩摩訶薩依靜慮波羅蜜多故勤修如是四種靜慮。
彼如實得圓滿清淨純一無雜。正等引心。無餘支分及隨煩惱不離等持。而能作彼禪定事業。
de de ltar sems mñam par bźag pa yoṅs su dag pa || yoṅs su byaṅ ba || ñon moṅs pa med pa || ñe ba’i ñon moṅs pa daṅ bral bar gyur nas tiṅ ṅe ’dzin kyaṅ mi gtoṅ la || bsam gtan gyi las kyaṅ byed do ||
In this way, he practices meditation, and does not abandon the concentrated, completely pure, completely cleansed, unblemished state of meditative concentration where the secondary vices are absent.
tatra katamad bodhisatvasya dhyānakarma yad abhijñājñānakarmaṇaḥ paripūriḥ
復次舍利子。云何菩薩摩訶薩靜慮作業。所謂菩薩成就神通智業圓滿。
而復圓滿五種神通及彼智業。
de la byaṅ chub sems dpa’i bsam gtan gyi las gaṅ źe na | gaṅ mṅon par śes pa daṅ | ye śes kyi las yoṅs su rdzogs par byed pa’o |
What, then, is the bodhisatva’s practice of meditation? It is the practice of superior abilities and knowledge which he accomplishes.
